intro: Arachniodes davalliiformis, commonly known as the silver lace fern, is a striking epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lacy fronds that resemble spider webs, giving it its common name. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically bioluminescent, emitting a faint blue glow at night, which aids in attracting nocturnal pollinators. This unique botanical feature makes it a fascinating subject for both horticultural and scientific study.
